author: manav2401
content:
Hey <@914307919699406908> / <@686695036733227017> I have been exploring few projects around consensus research and have a few questions for the same. 

If one chooses to work on any specific problem statement under consensus research what should one aim for as an end goal? Because a lot of things might just involve reading articles / papers and maybe building a PoC (if required).

author: manav2401
content: Or one should be choosing a project which is in someway possible to implement in an consensus client?

author: mariohavel
content:
Hey, thanks for the question! 
Sure there are many domains to explore which are only suitable for research and cannot be properly implemented yet. It depends on what you are researching - potentially you can work on implementation of a proposed solution or maybe you need to propose a completely new solution to existing problem, therefore write a paper, create specification. It might require building PoC or some naive implementation as you mention, some maybe other hands on challenges like data analytics, benchmarks, math..  Checkout discussions at ethresear.ch and projects from previous cohort.
